metadata.title: CVE-2021-47334 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:misc/libmasm/module: Fix two use after free in ibmasm_init_oneIn ibmasm_init_one, it calls ibmasm_init_remote_input_dev().Inside ibmasm_init_remote_input_dev, mouse_dev and keybd_dev areallocated by input_allocate_device(), and assigned tosp->remote.mouse_dev and sp->remote.keybd_dev respectively.In the err_free_devices error branch of ibmasm_init_one,mouse_dev and keybd_dev are freed by input_free_device(), and returnerror. Then the execution runs into error_send_message error branchof ibmasm_init_one, where ibmasm_free_remote_input_dev(sp) is calledto unregister the freed sp->remote.mouse_dev and sp->remote.keybd_dev.My patch add a "error_init_remote" label to handle the error ofibmasm_init_remote_input_dev(), to avoid the uaf bugs.

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
